div1.p: Gertrude [s.n.] expresses condolences on the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Gertrude [s.n.] to Laura Armistead Carter, [19--]
div1.p:
Louis probably delivered
my message to you but
anyway I want to write
to tell you again how
much we sympathize
with you in your loss.
C1
B20
You and your Father were
such constant companions
and co-workers that I
know it will be hard for
you. But at least you
have the satisfaction
of having made possible a
permanent record of your
Father's work and brilliant
thinking.

I know that you must
be weary and I hope you
will enjoy the visit to England
which Louis says you contemplate.

My love and sympathy to you
and Miss Mary and Henry,
